text: The most common minerals in gneiss are quartz , potassium feldspar , and plagioclase feldspar .
Gneisses made up primarily of dark minerals also occur .
Some gneisses will split along the layers of platy minerals , but most break in an irregular fashion .
Like schists , gneisses may also include large crystals of accessory minerals such as garnet .
Therefore , gneiss represents the highest-grade metamorphic rock in the sequence of shale , slate , phyllite , schist , and gneiss .
Thus , most gneisses consist of alternating bands of white or reddish feldspar-rich zones and layers of dark ferromagnesian minerals .
Gneiss Gneiss is the term applied to medium- to coarse-grained banded metamorphic rocks in which granular and elongated ( as opposed to platy ) minerals predominate .
Recall that during high-grade metamorphism , the light and dark components separate , giving gneisses their characteristic banded or layered appearance .
However , most gneisses are generated through highgrade metamorphism of shale .
Most gneisses also contain lesser amounts of biotite , muscovite , and amphibole .

For example , an amphibole-rich rock that exhibits a gneissic texture is called amphibolite .
